answers.answer: I cannot make a diagnosis without reviewing the films. Tumors typically have a different appearance on MRI when compared to MS lesions. If you are concerned I would encourage you to ask your neurologist this question, and perhaps request a second radiologist to review the films. Good luck.

I just wanted to encourage you to hang in there.  It took me six years to get a diagnosis. I have M.S..  Some of these neurological problems just take a very long time to figure out.  In the mean time, I would suggest that you get on with your life as best you can.  Theres no joy in feeling victemized by the uncertainty and often we imagine the worst, and the worst never actually comes to be. Speaking from experience over focus on your symptoms can sometimes make them feel worse and make you more miserable.

question: I am a 38 yr old female.  I am overweight and was diagnosed with diabetes 2 yrs ago but blood sugar levels are well controlled/A1C never over 6.  This past July I had severe back pain in my lower lft back.  The pain went up my back and down my lft leg. Severe pain lasted a couple of days and then just regular pain for about a mth.  Pain moved into lft hip and then lft thigh above knee & inside of thigh went numb. Lft leg was so weak I had to use railing to climb stairs.  MRI on back showed nothing.  Lft thigh remained numb so GP sent me to neuro.  She mentioned MS and I told her I didn't have symptoms except fatigue.  She sent me for brain MRI and did nerve conductivity test.  While waiting for results I did some research on MS and started realizing I did have several of the symptoms and most of them at the same time my back started hurting.  Aside from the numbness, I felt dizzy & lightheaded just sitting at my desk, some blurred vison. There were a few days in a row where when I picked up my soda can my hand would shake back and forth and I couldn't stop it. More leg cramps and stiffness than usual. I also had several issues of bladder urgency & difficulty controlling it. Noticed some problems with mental clarity also (hard to describe it) Nerve conductivity test came back normal.  MRI showed 1 lesion between frontal & parietal lobe/4 mm.  Doc says doesn't think MS because only 1 and denser than MS lesion, doesn't think it's causing the numbness.  Wants to wait 3 mths and do another MRI. Could it be a tumor?  If so, is waiting 3 mths a good idea?
title: MS, Tumor, Nothing?
